channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SWARM-325] ribbon-secured example does not work.
item.description:
I tried to run the ribbon-secured example following the README.md docuemnt. The frontend server is starting fine. The time server is running into an error with the port. It seems that the server is not picking up on the -Djboss.http.port=8081 parameter. I checked the system before starting and there is nothing on port 8081. The log:

martijnburger@VB01:~/NetBeansProjects/wildfly-swarm-examples/ribbon-secured/time$ mvn -Djboss.http.port=8081 wildfly-swarm:run

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Looks like that's a typo in the README - jboss.http.port was renamed to swarm.http.port. Can you try the latter and see if the example works better? I'll update the README.

Hey Toby,

Thanks for the quick followup. Looks like this works. I guess the events server also needs to run on his own port. Is it 8083?

mvn -Dswarm.http.port=8083 wildfly-swarm:run

I still don't see an output result, but that is not caused by the fact that the listener cannot start anymore.

The ribbon example should also be updated:

Instead of
mvn -Djboss.socket.binding.port-offset=1 wildfly-swarm:run
use
mvn -Dswarm.port.offset=1 wildfly-swarm:run
Thanks, I updated the README there as well. Do the ribbon examples work for you now?
Hi Toby. Unfortunately not, this was just one problem I encountered when trying the Ribbon example. I will open a separate issue for the rest.
I tried the Netflix OSS ribon example. This works with the port offset. There is another issue with the Javascript that I logged here. https://issues.jboss.org/browse/SWARM-326
